Package MAE1Project

Enum UI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<UI>
      • MAE1Project.UI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<UI>
    public enum UI
extends java.lang.Enum<UI>
    Author:
    Felix Zapata Date: 3/04/2019 UI class is implemented as an enum with the purpose of defining a Singleton class. Using enums to define singletons is described as the best way in Java for implementing this design pattern. The reason for UI for being a singleton is because multiple instantiation of this class is not necessary and since it will be used in multiple places along the code it is better to proceed with a singleton.

      • values

        public static UI[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (UI c : UI.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static UI valueOf​(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • inputScreenPattern

        public java.lang.String inputScreenPattern​(java.lang.String pattern,
                                           java.lang.String userIndication)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        inputScreenPattern methods returns the String input from the screen by the user following a given pre-stablished pattern;
        Parameters:
        pattern - : Regular expression pattern to be matched
        userIndication - : String indicating to the user the pattern to input
        Returns:
        String inputted by the user that succesfully matches the pattern
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • patternMatching

        public static boolean patternMatching​(java.lang.String pattern,
                                      java.lang.String myString)
        patternMatching static method determines if a given String input matches a pattern defined as a regular expression.
        Parameters:
        pattern - : String that constitutes the regular expression pattern.
        myString - : String to be contrasted with the pattern
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if there is match (true) or not (false).

      • printErrorMessage

        public void printErrorMessage​(int nAttempsRemaining)
        printErrorMessage prints a common message when an exception has been detected associated to an improper user input.
        Parameters:
        nAttempsRemaining - : integer indicating the number of attempts remaining the user has to input in a correct fashion.
